attributes.action: Make concessionary bus fares for children last until they are 16 or 18 in full time education and make them a more reasonable price.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Children in education don't have time to have a proper job and many don't have time for even a Saturday job if they study a lot. Why then, should they pay the same price as someone who earns a salary? Children who are 14 or sometimes even younger are made to pay an adult fare. How is this fair when they simply are not adults?
The prices that under 14s pay are sometimes still far too expensive. How can it be right that a child is made to pay almost £5 to ride a few miles to the nearest town?
